Detailed Description

Defines an ACIA (Asynchronous Communication Interface Adapter) device.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Constructor. Initialize ACIA device.

ACIA::~ACIA (   ) 
 

Destructor. Deallocate the data used by the ACIA device.

Member Function Documentation

char ACIA::GetChar (   ) 
 

To get the input data register value.

RegStatus ACIA::GetInputStateReg (   ) 
 

To get the input register's value (For the Busy Waiting mode).

RegStatus ACIA::GetOutputStateReg (   ) 
 

To get the output register's state value.

int ACIA::GetWorkingMode (  void   ) 
 

Get the current working mode for the ACIA (Interrupt or Busy Waiting).

void ACIA::PutChar (  char   ) 
 

To put a output in the reception data register.

void ACIA::SetWorkingMode (  int  mod  ) 
 

Change the working mode for the ACIA. The parameter is a bitwise OR of flags defining the interrupts allowed (emission or reception). It must be used to enable/disable reception and emission interrupts in the Interrupt mode.

Friends And Related Function Documentation

friend class ACIA_sysdep [friend]
 

The class ACIA_sysdep is in charge of the system dependent parts of the ACIA, using UDP sockets. It will be able to write on the registers of an object from the class ACIA.
